code: @Article{,   title = {{USAboundaries}: Historical and Contemporary Boundaries of the United States of America},   author = {Lincoln A. Mullen and Jordan Bratt},   journal = {Journal of Open Source Software},   year = {2018},   volume = {3},   issue = {23},   pages = {314},   url = {https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.00314},   doi = {10.21105/joss.00314}, }

title: Historical and Contemporary Boundaries of the United States of America
text: R package includes contemporary state, county, Congressional district boundaries, well zip code tabulation area centroids. also includes historical boundaries 1629 2000 states counties Newberry Library’s Atlas Historical County Boundaries, well historical city population data Erik Steiner’s “United States Historical City Populations, 1790-2010.” package helper data, including table state names, abbreviations, FIPS codes, functions data get State Plane Coordinate System projections EPSG codes PROJ.4 strings. package can serve number purposes. spatial data can joined kind data order make thematic maps. Unlike R packages, package also contains historical data use analyses recent distant past. See “sample analysis using USAboundaries” vignette example package can used historical contemporary maps.

title: Historical and Contemporary Boundaries of the United States of America

Mullen and Jordan Bratt, "USAboundaries: Historical and #>   Contemporary Boundaries of the United States of America," Journal of #>   Open Source Software 3, no. 23 (2018): 314, #>   https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.00314. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Article{, #>     title = {{USAboundaries}: Historical and Contemporary Boundaries #> of the United States of America}, #>     author = {Lincoln A. title: Historical and Contemporary Boundaries of the United States of America
text: can install package CRAN. Almost data package provided USAboundariesData package. package automatically installed (permission) rOpenSci package repository first time need . can install development versions GitHub using remotes.
code: install.packages("USAboundaries") # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ropensci/USAboundaries") remotes::install_github("ropensci/USAboundariesData")

title: Historical and Contemporary Boundaries of the United States of America
text: package provides set functions, one types boundaries available. functions consistent interface. Passing date us_states(), us_counties(), us_cities() returns historical boundaries date. date argument passed, contemporary boundaries returned. functions us_congressional() us_zipcodes() offer contemporary boundaries. almost functions, pass character vector state names abbreviations states = argument return states territories. certain functions, less detailed boundary information available passing argument resolution = argument. See examples see interface works, see documentation function details.
code: library(USAboundaries)  library(sf) # for plotting and projection methods #> Linking to GEOS 3.9.1, GDAL 3.3.2, PROJ 8.1.1  states_1840 <- us_states("1840-03-12") plot(st_geometry(states_1840)) title("U.S. state boundaries on March 3, 1840") states_contemporary <- us_states() plot(st_geometry(states_contemporary)) title("Contemporary U.S. state boundaries") counties_va_1787 <- us_counties("1787-09-17", states = "Virginia") plot(st_geometry(counties_va_1787)) title("County boundaries in Virginia in 1787") counties_va <- us_counties(states = "Virginia") plot(st_geometry(counties_va)) title("Contemporary county boundaries in Virginia") counties_va_highres <- us_counties(states = "Virginia", resolution = "high") plot(st_geometry(counties_va_highres)) title("Higher resolution contemporary county boundaries in Virginia") congress <- us_congressional(states = "California") plot(st_geometry(congress)) title("Congressional district boundaries in California")

title: Historical and Contemporary Boundaries of the United States of America
text: state_plane() function returns EPSG codes PROJ.4 strings State Plane Coordinate System. can use use suitable projections specific states.
code: va <- us_states(states = "VA", resolution = "high") plot(st_geometry(va), graticule = TRUE) va_projection <- state_plane("VA") va <- st_transform(va, va_projection) plot(st_geometry(va), graticule = TRUE)

title: Historical and Contemporary Boundaries of the United States of America
text: function returns sf object sf package, can mapped using leaflet ggplot2 packages. need U.S. Census Bureau boundary files provided package, consider using tigris package, downloads shapefiles.

title: Historical and Contemporary Boundaries of the United States of America
text: historical boundary data provided package available CC -NC-SA 2.5 license John H. Long, et al., Atlas Historical County Boundaries, Dr. William M. Scholl Center American History Culture, Newberry Library, Chicago (2010). Please cite project use package research abide terms license use historical information. historical population data cities provided U.S. Census Bureau Erik Steiner, Spatial History Project, Center Spatial Textual Analysis, Stanford University. See data repository. contemporary data provided U.S. Census Bureau public domain. code package copyright Lincoln Mullen released MIT license.

title: State codes and abbreviations for U.S. states and territories — state_codes
text: data.frame 69 rows 4 variables: state_name state territory name state_abbr two character abbreviation state territory. state_code three digit numeric FIPS code state territory. jurisdiction_type One state, territory, district.

what: Projections from the State Plane Coordinate System — state_plane
title: Projections from the State Plane Coordinate System — state_plane
text: Get EPSG codes PROJ.4 codes projections State Plane Coordinate System.

title: Projections from the State Plane Coordinate System — state_plane
code: state_plane(state, plane_id = NULL, type = c("epsg", "proj4"))

title: Projections from the State Plane Coordinate System — state_plane
text: state postal code state. plane_id state plane geographic zone identifier. NULL value return projection entire state. type type output return: either EPSG code PROJ4 string.

title: Projections from the State Plane Coordinate System — state_plane
text: Either PROJ4 string character vector EPSG code   integer.

title: Projections from the State Plane Coordinate System — state_plane
code: if (require(USAboundariesData)) {   state_plane(state = "MA", type = "epsg")   state_plane(state = "MA", type = "proj4")   state_plane(state = "MA", plane_id = "island", type = "epsg")   state_plane(state = "MA", plane_id = "island", type = "proj4")    # Show the difference made by a state plane projection   if (require(sf)) {     va <- us_states(states = "VA", resolution = "high")     plot(st_geometry(va), graticule = TRUE)     va <- st_transform(va, state_plane("VA"))     plot(st_geometry(va), graticule = TRUE)   } } #> Loading required package: USAboundariesData #> Loading required package: sf #> Linking to GEOS 3.10.2, GDAL 3.4.1, PROJ 8.2.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE

what: City locations and populations (historical and contemporary) — us_cities
title: City locations and populations (historical and contemporary) — us_cities
text: function returns sf object cities (populated places) populations latitudes longitudes. Population data taken U.S. Census.

title: City locations and populations (historical and contemporary) — us_cities
code: us_cities(map_date = NULL, states = NULL)

title: City locations and populations (historical and contemporary) — us_cities
text: map_date NULL, city populations 2010 census (recent census) returned. parameter accepts Date object character string coercible Date object, well numeric values representing year. year date used, city populations decennial census 1790 2010 prior year returned. example, 1805 "1805-07-04" return city populations 1800 census. states character vector state territory names abbreviations. boundaries states/territories returned. NULL, boundaries returned.

title: City locations and populations (historical and contemporary) — us_cities
text: data compiled Erik Steiner Jason Heppler   Center Spatial Textual Analysis, Stanford University. See   description    data fuller accounting data gathered.

title: City locations and populations (historical and contemporary) — us_cities
code: if (require(USAboundariesData)) {   us_cities(1805)   us_cities("1828-05-08")   us_cities() } #> City populations for contemporary data come from the 2010 census. #> Simple feature collection with 6932 features and 12 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -166.5251 ymin: 19.09679 xmax: -67.23919 ymax: 71.25408 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 6,932 × 13 #>    city      state_name state_abbr county    county_name stplfips_2010 name_2010 #>    <chr>     <chr>      <chr>      <chr>     <chr>       <chr>         <chr>     #>  1 Anchorage Alaska     AK         THIRD JU… Third Judi… 0203000       Anchorag… #>  2 Barrow    Alaska     AK         North Sl… North Slop… 0205200       Barrow c… #>  3 Bethel    Alaska     AK         Bethel C… Bethel Cen… 0206520       Bethel c… #>  4 Fairbanks Alaska     AK         FOURTH J… Fourth Jud… 0224230       Fairbank… #>  5 Homer     Alaska     AK         Kenai Pe… Kenai Peni… 0233140       Homer ci… #>  6 Juneau    Alaska     AK         FIRST JU… First Judi… 0236400       Juneau c… #>  7 Kenai     Alaska     AK         Kenai Pe… Kenai Peni… 0238420       Kenai ci… #>  8 Ketchikan Alaska     AK         FIRST JU… First Judi… 0238970       Ketchika… #>  9 Kodiak    Alaska     AK         Kodiak I… Kodiak Isl… 0240950       Kodiak c… #> 10 Kotzebue  Alaska     AK         Northwes… Northwest … 0241830       Kotzebue… #> # ℹ 6,922 more rows #> # ℹ 6 more variables: city_source <chr>, population_source <chr>, #> #   place_type <chr>, year <int>, population <int>, geometry <POINT [°]>

title: County boundaries (contemporary and historical) — us_counties

code: us_counties(map_date = NULL, resolution = c("low", "high"), states = NULL)

title: County boundaries (contemporary and historical) — us_counties
text: map_date date boundaries object coercible date .Date(); easiest option character vector following ISO 8601 data format. NULL (default) contemporary boundaries returned. resolution resolution map. states character vector state territory names abbreviations. boundaries states/territories returned. NULL, boundaries returned.

title: County boundaries (contemporary and historical) — us_counties
text: sf object.

title: County boundaries (contemporary and historical) — us_counties
code: if (require(USAboundariesData) && require(sf)) {   contemporary_us  <- us_counties()   historical_us    <- us_counties("1820-07-04")   contemporary_ne  <- us_counties(states = c("Massachusetts", "Vermont", "Maine",                                              "New Hampshire", "Rhode Island",                                              "Connecticut"))   historical_ne    <- us_counties("1803-04-28",                                   states = c("Massachusetts", "Vermont", "Maine",                                              "New Hampshire", "Rhode Island",                                              "Connecticut"),                                   resolution = "high")    plot(st_geometry(contemporary_us))   plot(st_geometry(historical_us))   plot(st_geometry(contemporary_ne))   plot(st_geometry(historical_ne)) }

title: State boundaries (contemporary and historical) — us_states
code: contemporary_us <- us_states()  if (require(USAboundariesData) && require(sf)) {   historical_us   <- us_states("1820-07-04")   contemporary_ne <- us_states(states = c("Massachusetts", "Vermont", "Maine",                                           "New Hampshire", "Rhode Island",                                           "Connecticut"))   historical_ne   <- us_states(as.Date("1805-03-12"),                                states = c("Massachusetts", "Vermont", "Maine",                                           "New Hampshire", "Rhode Island",                                           "Connecticut"),                                resolution = "high")    plot(st_geometry(contemporary_us))    plot(st_geometry(historical_us))    plot(st_geometry(contemporary_ne))    plot(st_geometry(historical_ne)) }

title: USAboundaries 0.3.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-03-29 New vignette demonstrating package’s functionality (#40). Additions clarifications documentation following @AndySouth’s suggestions JOSS peer review (#38). us_cities() now returns sf object rather data frame (#36). us_cities() gains states argument match functions package (#35). Citation JOSS paper.

title: USAboundaries 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-10-12 Update data files use current version sf package. Update Census Bureau data 2016 2020. Remove us_boundaries() function needless wrapper around functions. Prompt user install data package rather installing .

title: USAboundaries 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-07-08 Moved data USAboundariesData. improves loading time permits frequent updates user-facing package. Added state plane projections table functions (@jfbratt). Now users can get appropriate projection state. Converted boundary objects sf objects. Updated contemporary census boundaries 2014 2016 versions. Added zipcode tabulation area centroids. Added historical city populations compiled Erik Steiner CESTA/Stanford University.

title: USAboundaries 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-01-04 Added contemporary boundaries states, counties, congressional districts. Import many fewer packages. us_boundaries() function longer option return fortified data frame. assumed users convert SpatialPolygonsDataFrame objects whatever format need. High resolution data now available USAboundariesData package.

title: USAboundaries 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2014-12-24 Fix README.md requested CRAN.

title: USAboundaries 0.1
text: CRAN release: 2014-11-25 Initial release. us_boundaries() returns sp object data frame can plotted.
